result.execSummary:
The defendant Caprice S Barksdale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 10/27/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Court suspend driving privileges for a period of 6 months.
Consecutive to: to any sentence. Huber for child care. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caprice S Barksdale

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Caprice S Barksdale in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Caprice S Barksdale in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 9 days served; Huber privileges for child care. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. 

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 10/27/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court suspend driving privileges for a period of 6 months.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Caprice S Barksdale in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has picked up a new charge in Ozaukee county.    The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Discharge Summary from JusticePoint received and filed.  LMS
Per request of State, case is adjourned from 7/7/2015 to 6/23/2015.  Parties notified.  lms
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Non-Compliance report, received and filed. lms
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Caprice S Barksdale in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

Defendant had all negative tests, made all contacts, and began community service. Case adjourned to branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-12-2015

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-12-2015
NO GUN OR DRUG ORDER, signed and filed. lms

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms or applying for conceal and carry permit.

Defendant Caprice S Barksdale in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 310 Safety Building on 4/6/15 @ 10 am
